list.name: Changes
list.comment: Add validation constraints for password fields - Add 'Length' constraint to 'actualPassword' field with min 8 and max 50 characters - Add 'Length' constraint to 'plainPassword' field with min 8 and max 50 characters - Ensure that both new and confirmed passwords meet the length requirements

task.summary: Default task
Fix some

- Added the database connection details to the .env file

change the server-version of mysql

feat(database): add first_name and last_name to user table
- Created a new migration file 'Version20240726190123_add_first_last_name_to_user_table.php' - The migration file contains the following changes: - Added two new columns to the 'user' table: - first_name (string, 100 characters) - last_name (string, 100 characters) - Executed the migration to add the new columns to the existing 'user' table in the database - This update allows storing the first and last name of users, which is necessary for user profiles and personalization

feat(database): add first_name and last_name to user table
- Created a new migration file 'Version20240726190123_add_first_last_name_to_user_table.php' - The migration file contains the following changes: - Added two new columns to the 'user' table: - first_name (string, 100 characters) - last_name (string, 100 characters) - Executed the migration to add the new columns to the existing 'user' table in the database - This update allows storing the first and last name of users, which is necessary for user profiles and personalization
Created the RegisterController - Generated via the `php artisan make:controller RegisterController` command

Created the RegisterUserType form class - Generated via the `php artisan make:form RegisterUserType` command - Represents the form fields and validation rules for user registration - Centralizes the form logic and can be used in the RegisterController

Displayed the register form - Created the form with the RegisterController using the `createForm(RegisterUserType::class)` method - Passed the created form to the view as `registerForm` - Allows displaying the user registration form in the `register/index.html.twig` template
Configured Twig for forms - Added the `form_themes: ['bootstrap_5_layout.html.twig']` configuration to use the Bootstrap 5 form theme

Implement registration form fields - Add email, password, firstname, and lastname fields to the registration form - Set appropriate form field types (EmailType, PasswordType, TextType) - Add placeholder attributes for each field to enhance user experience - Add a submit button with the label "Inscrire" and a success button class

feat: Implement user registration functionality - Inject Request and EntityManagerInterface into the controller action - Create a new User entity instance - Create the RegisterUserType form and bind it to the User entity - Handle the form submission and process the valid form data - Use the EntityManager to persist the new User entity and flush the changes to the database

Add password confirmation and hashing to user registration - Implement a repeated password field using the RepeatedType - Set the first_options to include the label, placeholder, and hash_property_path for the main password field - Set the second_options to include the label and placeholder for the confirmation password field - Mark the 'plainPassword' field as unmapped ('mapped' => false) to prevent it from being directly persisted to the database - The hashed password will be stored in the 'password' property of the User entity

Add length constraints to user registration fields - Implement length constraints on the 'plainPassword' field using the Length constraint - Set the minimum length to 8 characters and the maximum length to 50 characters for the password - Implement length constraints on the 'firstName' and 'lastName' fields using the Length constraint - Set the minimum length to 2 characters and the maximum length to 50 characters for the first and last name - This ensures that the user's password and name fields meet the minimum security and validation requirements - The hashed password will still be stored in the 'password' property of the User entity

Add unique email constraint to user registration form - Implement the UniqueEntity constraint on the 'email' field of the user registration form - This constraint ensures that the email address entered by the user is unique in the database - If a user tries to register with an email address that is already in use, the form will display an error message - The 'entityClass' option is set to the User entity class, as the form is already bound to this entity - The 'fields' option specifies that the constraint should be applied to the 'email' field - The 'message' option sets the custom error message to be displayed if the email is not unique - This change reinforces the data integrity of the user accounts by preventing duplicate email addresses

Create LoginController
- Generated a new controller using the Symfony make:controller command

Enable FormLoginAuthenticator with form_login setting
- Configured the form_login setting in security.yaml - Set the login_path and check_path to the 'app_login' route

Enable FormLoginAuthenticator with form_login setting
- Configured the form_login setting in security.yaml - Set the login_path and check_path to the 'app_login' route

Enable FormLoginAuthenticator with form_login setting
- Configured the form_login setting in security.yaml - Set the login_path and check_path to the 'app_login' route

Implement login form in template
- Added the login form HTML markup in the login/index.html.twig template - Included the necessary input fields for username and password - Displayed the authentication error message if present - Used the app_login route for the form action

Style the login form with Bootstrap
- Applied Bootstrap classes to the login form elements - Added custom CSS classes 'my_input' and 'my_button' for further styling - Centered the form container on larger screens using media queries - Improved the overall visual appearance and responsiveness of the login form

Implement logout functionality
- Added a new route '/deconnexion' with the name 'app_logout' and the HTTP method 'GET' - Defined a logout action in the controller that throws an exception, as the logout is handled by the security system - This allows the user to be logged out of the application when accessing the '/deconnexion' URL

onfigure logout functionality in the security firewall
- Updated the security firewall configuration to enable the logout functionality - Added a 'logout' configuration with the path set to '/logout' - This allows users to log out of the application by accessing the '/logout' URL
modify the logout path in the security.yaml to "/deconnexion" as in the logout route

Implement private member area with AccountController
- Created a new AccountController to handle the private member area functionality

Restrict access to member area with security configuration
- Added an 'access_control' configuration in the security firewall - Restricted access to the '/compte' path to users with the 'ROLE_USER' role - This ensures that only authenticated users with the 'ROLE_USER' role can access the member area pages

Redirect users to member area after login
- Added a hidden input field with the name '_target_path' and the value set to the path of the member area page ('app_account') - This ensures that after a successful login, the user is redirected to the member area page ('app_account') instead of the default redirect location - Improves the user experience by directly taking the user to the member area after authentication

Add user account navigation menu
- Created a new Twig template file named "_menu.html.twig" to hold the user account navigation menu - Added the menu items: "Mes commandes", "Mes adresses", "Modifier mot de passe", and "Me deconnecter"

Add user account link with conditional display
- Added conditional logic to display the user's first name and account link if the user is logged in - If the user is not logged in, display a generic user icon linked to the login page - Leverages Symfony's app.user object to check if a user is authenticated - Uses Twig's path function to generate the URLs for the account and login pages
Improve form layout and styling
create modify password route
add the modifyPassword view and pass the modifyPasswordForm to the view

Add fields for changing password - Add 'actualPassword' field for current password - Add 'plainPassword' field with repeated password type for new password - Add 'Submit' button with 'Mettre à jour' label

Add validation constraints for password fields - Add 'Length' constraint to 'actualPassword' field with min 8 and max 50 characters - Add 'Length' constraint to 'plainPassword' field with min 8 and max 50 characters - Ensure that both new and confirmed passwords meet the length requirements

Add custom website icon - Added a new Twig block named 'icon' to include a custom icon for the website
